title: How to bypass activation and protection of a software using Enigma Protector?
content:
I have a software that is protected with Enigma Protector and I am trying to analyze it and bypass the activation process. I have the following:

A valid HWID and activation key that worked previously.

The registry files that were created during the activation of the program.

A copy of the program that was working previously.

I would like to understand how the protection mechanism works, especially how the activation and HWID checks are done, and what steps I can take to bypass or disable the protection.

I have already tried to analyze it using tools like x64dbg, but I am having trouble identifying the protection routines.

Any help or guidance on where to focus my efforts or any tools that might be helpful for this type of analysis would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!
